Posts.Content: May 12, 2011 09:30PM mlabroli wrote: So sorry to hear about your recent diagnosis- and I am in a similar situation.  I am 35 just diagnosed April 5, I have 2 little boys 6.5 and 2.5.  ANd I am completely overwhelmed.  Have seen 2 breast surgeons at a big cancer center, and am meeting with the plastic surgeon on monday.  I have already 99% decided on bilateral mastectomy - becasue I want this to be over.  I have a positive node, so I am waiting to hear my chemo options and am SO scared about that as well.  Just found this website tonight and I love it already.  Hearing about everyone's positive story is empowering.  Please keep me posted with your updates...big hug!
Posts.Title: just diagnosed with bc justdiagnosed AJTAYLOR

Posts.Content: May 17, 2011 07:02PM mlabroli wrote: Thanks so much for the reply!  So, you are doing your chemo first- I still don't have my plan yet, but as of know looks like bilateral mastectomy then chemo and radiation, hoping to find out more next week on the follow-up appt with the BS.  Met the plastic surgeon and am SO confused on reconstruction vs. implants...think I might start a new discussion post on that one--check out mdg's blog it was SUPER inspiring for me!
Posts.Title: just diagnosed with bc justdiagnosed AJTAYLOR

Posts.Content: May 12, 2011 11:14PM mlabroli wrote: HI Kat, I am living your nightmare--almost word for word.   I was 34 yo at diagnosis but just turned 35 1 month ago--2 days after diagnosis.  I work in healthcare as well -- I am a pediatrician, so all this is just as overwhelming and unbelievable as you posted. I have met with 2 breast surgeons, the first at a small community hospital the second at a huge cancer tertiary care center.  I am sticking with the latter- he just seems more informed.  I had a surgical biopsy after I was told "it was probably nothing", and since have had a positive sentinel node biopsy.  I am meeting with a plastic surgeon next monday may 16.  I am 99% sure I will do bilateral mastectomy - but am SO scared to think about the possibly of chemo after--how long will that take, will I still be able to work, don't really want to lose my hair, and I have 2 small kids - 6yo and 2 yo.  Also so scared about tamoxifen for 5 years after- if anyone knows what this is like premenopausal please let me know.  I cry too, but mostly I just don't sleep.  You are in my prayers--good luck with the surgeon --
Posts.Title: Feels like a bad dream... kks_rd kks_rd

Posts.Content: May 17, 2011 08:54PM mlabroli wrote: Oh Kat...I'm sorry to hear about yesterday's news.  I am still waiting to hear, but assuming with our young age, that I will be positive as well.  Just heard I am likely to have radiaition plus chemo, will find out more next week---everyday is like a new surprise, waiting for a good day!  But stay strong, I am trying to only think about tomoorw because I get too overwhelmed otherwise---good luck!
Posts.Title: Feels like a bad dream... kks_rd kks_rd
